Brighamia insignis
The Hawaiian Alula is a highly endangered endemic perennial plant that lives on the cliffs of the Kauai and Niihau islands. The plant was once pollinated by a now-extinct species of hawk moth, which means that the only way to grow more of these plants is to hand pollinate them. It is also known as the Pua'ala, and has traditionally been used for medicines.
